meanings.definition: To place (a dead body) in a grave or tomb.
meanings.sent1: The family decided to inter the deceased in the family plot.
meanings.sent2: The funeral procession solemnly interred the casket in the cemetery.
meanings.sent3: As they were interring the body, a squirrel popped out of the nearby tree, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her past were interred deep within her heart, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The act of interring the body brought closure to the grieving family.

meanings.sent1: They will inter the deceased in the churchyard tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, it is customary to inter the body facing east.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to think he was helping by interring his bone in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the ancient civilization were interred beneath layers of sand and time.
meanings.sent5: The act of interring the body is a final farewell to the departed.

meanings.definition: To place in a grave or tomb; bury.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists will inter the artifacts in a museum for preservation.
meanings.sent2: It is a tradition in this village to inter the deceased on the hill overlooking the town.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to be archaeologists, interring their toys in a makeshift tomb.
meanings.sent4: The old diary was interred in a hidden compartment, waiting to be discovered by future generations.
meanings.sent5: The act of interring the ancient relics brought a sense of reverence to the team.
